name: Deoxys Normal Forme
flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokemon.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Normal Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Normal Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Deoxys Normal Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Dragonite
flavorText: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin for each of your opponent's Pokemon. If that coin flip is heads, this attack does 50 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Froslass
flavorText: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees F. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
Attack1Text: Discard a Psychic Energy attached to Froslass. During your opponent's next turn, if Froslass would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, the Attacking Pokemon is Knocked Out.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep. Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon.

name: Giratina
flavorText: A Pokemon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Giratina during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Gliscor
flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
Attack1Text: Choose either Burned or Poisoned. The Defending Pokemon is now affected by that Special Condition. You may return Gliscor and all cards attached to it to your hand.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Heatran
flavorText: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Fire Energy attached to 1 of your Pokemon to Heatran. This power can't be used if Heatran is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: You may discard as many basic Energy cards as you like attached to Heatran. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

name: Kingdra
flavorText: It lives in caves on the seafloor and creates giant whirlpools every time it moves.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for as many Water Energy cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and this attack does 10 damage for each Water Energy card you chose. Put those cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: You may discard 2 cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Luxray
flavorText: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
Ability1Text: If your opponent has any Pokemon LV.X in play, each of Luxray's attacks does 50 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Luxray.
Attack2Text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Luxray.

name: Mamoswine
flavorText: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: You may do 60 damage plus 40 more damage and 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If you do, Mamoswine does 40 damage to itself.

name: Metagross
flavorText: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with 1 of the Defending Pokemon. This power can't be used if Metagross is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Metagross's Extra Comet Punch attack's base damage is 100.

name: Mewtwo
flavorText: A Pokemon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokemon.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Politoed
flavorText: It gathers groups of others as their leader. Its cries make Poliwag obey.
Ability1Text: If you have Poliwag, Poliwhirl, and Poliwrath in play, each of these Pokemon's attacks does 60 more damage to the Defending Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Probopass
flavorText: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units call Mini-Noses.
Ability1Text: Any damage done to Probopass by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 10 for each Metal Energy attached to Probopass (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't reduce more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack1Text: Choose a number of your opponent's Benched Pokemon up to the amount of Metal Energy attached to Probopass. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Rayquaza
flavorText: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Fire Energy card or a basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza. This power can't be used if Rayquaza is affected by a Special Condition or if you have another Rayquaza in play.
Attack1Text: Discard all Energy attached to Rayquaza.

name: Regigigas
flavorText: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokemon towed continents with ropes.
Ability1Text: Regigigas can't attack until your opponent has 3 or less Prize cards left.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 120.

name: Spiritomb
flavorText: A Pokemon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Spiritomb from your hand onto your Bench, you may put 1 damage counter on all Pokemon that already have any damage counters on them (both yours and your opponent's). You can't use more than 1 Curse Breath Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: Move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokemon to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Yanmega
flavorText: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and switch Yanmega with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Armaldo
flavorText: It went ashore after evolving. Its entire body is clad in a sturdy armor.
Ability1Text: If Armaldo would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Armaldo if that damage is 60 or less.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 40 more damage.

name: Azelf
flavorText: Known as "The Being of Willpower." It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Azelf from your hand onto your Bench, you may look at all of your face-down Prize cards. If you do, you may choose 1 Pokemon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Then, choose 1 card in your hand and put it as a Prize card face down.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Bellossom
flavorText: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.
Attack1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Vileplume and each Bellossom you have in play. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Cradily
flavorText: It lives in the shallows of warm seas. When the tide goes out, it digs up prey from beaches.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokemon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. If you do, this attack does 30 damage to the new Defending Pokemon. If the Defending Pokemon would be Knocked Out by this attack, you may remove all damage counters from Cradily.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Crawdaunt
flavorText: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokemon from its pond.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent returns the Defending Pokemon and all cards attached to it to his or her hand.
Attack2Text: If Crawdaunt has a Technical Machine card attached to it, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Delcatty
flavorText: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.
Ability1Text: If Delcatty is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Delcatty is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Deoxys Attack Forme
flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokemon.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Attack Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Attack Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Deoxys Attack Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Deoxys's Psychic Boost attack's base damage is 20.

name: Deoxys Defense Forme
flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokemon.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Defense Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Defense Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Deoxys Defense Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of an attack, and any damage done to Deoxys by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Deoxys Speed Forme
flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokemon.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Speed Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Speed Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Deoxys Speed Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokemon.

name: Ditto
flavorText: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
Ability1Text: As long as Ditto is your Active Pokemon, its maximum HP is the same as your opponent's Active Pokemon. Ditto can use the attacks of that Pokemon as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.) If that Pokemon is no longer your opponent's Active Pokemon, choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokemon for Ditto to copy.

name: Forretress
flavorText: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.
Ability1Text: Whenever you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to Forretress (excluding effects of attacks), you may flip a coin. If tails, put 2 damage counters on each Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding any Forretress).
Attack1Text: Forretress does 40 damage to itself.

name: Groudon
flavorText: It had been asleep in underground magma ever since it fiercely fought Kyogre long ago.
Attack1Text: Choose up to 2 basic Fighting Energy cards from your hand and attach them to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fighting Energy attached to Groudon and this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Heatran
flavorText: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Metal Energy attached to 1 of your Pokemon to Heatran. This power can't be used if Heatran is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Metal Energy attached to Heatran. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Jirachi
flavorText: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for any 1 card. Shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy attached to Jirachi. The Defending Pokemon is Knocked Out at the end of your opponent's next turn.

name: Kyogre
flavorText: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.
Attack1Text: Choose up to 2 basic Water Energy cards from your hand and attach them to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Water Energy attached to Kyogre. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Lopunny
flavorText: An extremely cautious Pokemon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.
Ability1Text: As long as Lopunny is your Active Pokemon, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Benched Pokemon between turns.
Attack1Text: Draw 3 cards.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon is an Evolved Pokemon, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Mesprit
flavorText: Known as "The Being of Emotion." It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Mesprit from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this power. Your opponent can't use any Poke-Powers on his or her Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack1Text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

name: Poliwrath
flavorText: With extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
Attack1Text: If Poliwrath was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Poliwrath does 20 damage to itself.

name: Regice
flavorText: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Discard 2 cards from your hand and choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokemon that isn't an Evolved Pokemon. Then, your opponent switches that Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon. This power can't be used if Regice is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: If Regice was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Regigigas
flavorText: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokemon towed continents with ropes.
Ability1Text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to Regigigas, remove all Special Conditions from Regigigas.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Regirock
flavorText: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have a Fighting Energy card in your discard pile, you may discard 2 cards from your hand. Then, attach a Fighting Energy card from your discard pile to Regirock. This power can't be used if Regirock is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Registeel
flavorText: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 2 cards from your hand. Then, remove 3 damage counters from Registeel. This power can't be used if Registeel is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Registeel. If you do, search your discard pile for an Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to Registeel.

name: Shedinja
flavorText: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one's spirit.
Ability1Text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Shedinja would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon and each of the opponent's Pokemon that has the same name as the Attacking Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Put 3 damage counters on the Defending Pokemon. If Shedinja has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Torkoal
flavorText: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
Ability1Text: As long as Torkoal is your Active Pokemon, prevent all effects, including damage, done to your Benched Pokemon by your opponent's attacks.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned and Paralyzed.

name: Unown [!]
flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown ! from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. If tails, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Unown ! does 10 damage to itself, and this attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Uxie
flavorText: Known as "The Being of Knowledge." It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Uxie from your hand onto your Bench, you may draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.
Attack1Text: You may put Uxie and all cards attached to it on the bottom of your deck in any order.

name: Victreebel
flavorText: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Burned and Poisoned. Before applying these effects, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokemon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. The new Defending Pokemon is now Burned and Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

name: Vileplume
flavorText: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a Grass or Psychic Energy card from your hand to Vileplume (excluding effects of attacks or Poke-Powers), you may use this power. If you attach a Grass Energy card, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep. If you attach a Psychic Energy card, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

name: Anorith
flavorText: A Pokemon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Anorith by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Camerupt
flavorText: It has volcanoes on its back. If magma builds up in its body, it shudders, then erupts violently.
Attack1Text: Each player discards the top of his or her deck. This attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: Camerupt does 20 damage to itself.

name: Castform
flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform. (Any cards attached to Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) If you do, put Castform on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: If you have a Stadium card in play, remove 3 damage counters from Castform. If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Castform Rain Form
flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Rain Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Rain Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) Shuffle Castform Rain Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: The defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Castform Snow-Cloud Form
flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Snow-cloud Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Snow-cloud Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) Shuffle Castform Snow-cloud Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Castform Sunny Form
flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Sunny Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Sunny Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokemon.) Shuffle Castform Sunny Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Castform Sunny Form.

name: Dragonair
flavorText: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Drifblim
flavorText: It's drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Drifblim by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

name: Exeggutor
flavorText: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
Attack1Text: Each player counts the number of cards in his or her opponent's hand. Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a number of cards up to the number of cards his or her opponent had. (You draw your cards first.)
Attack2Text: Discard as many Energy cards as you like attached to your Pokemon. For each Energy card you discarded, flip a coin. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

name: Gliscor
flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Grumpig
flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psycho-power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused. Put 6 damage counters instead of 3 on the Confused Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Grumpig.

name: Houndoom
flavorText: Long ago, people imagined its eerie howls to be the call of the grim reaper.
Ability1Text: If you have less Benched Pokemon than your opponent, each of Houndoom's attacks does 40 more damage to the Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Houndoom.

name: Lanturn
flavorText: Lanturn's light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed "The Deep-Sea Star."
Attack1Text: Move an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon to another of your opponent's Pokemon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Lanturn
flavorText: Lanturn's light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed "The Deep-Sea Star."
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lanturn.

name: Ledian
flavorText: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.
Attack1Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: You may switch Ledian with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. If you do, move as many Energy cards attached to Ledian as you like to the new Active Pokemon.

name: Lucario
flavorText: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Luxio
flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Luxio.

name: Marowak
flavorText: From its birth, this savage Pokemon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Marowak can't use Heavy Bone during your next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

name: Metang
flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won't be scratched if it collides with a jet.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Metang during your opponent's next turn.

name: Metang
flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won't be scratched if it collides with a jet.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Mightyena
flavorText: It chases down prey in a pack. It will never disobey the commands of a skilled Trainer.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon isn't an Evolved Pokemon, that Pokemon can't attack, retreat, or use any Poke-Powers during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokemon you have in play.

name: Ninjask
flavorText: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Ninjask from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon and if your Bench isn't full, you may put Shedinja onto your Bench as a Basic Pokemon from your hand or your discard pile.
Attack1Text: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in his or her hand, discard a number of cards without looking until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand.

name: Persian
flavorText: A very haughty Pokemon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poke-Powers, Poke-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Piloswine
flavorText: Its shaggy coat makes it unable to see. It checks surroundings with its sensitive nose instead.
Attack1Text: You may do 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Piloswine does 30 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Seadra
flavorText: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.
Attack1Text: You may discard up to 2 Water Energy cards from your hand. If you do, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

name: Starmie
flavorText: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
Attack1Text: You may return Starmie and all cards attached to it to your hand.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that has any Poke-Powers or Poke-Bodies. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Swalot
flavorText: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokemon and Swalot. If the Defending Pokemon has fewer remaining HP than Swalot's, this attack does 80 damage instead.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Swellow
flavorText: It circles the sky in search of prey. When it spots one, it dive steeply to catch the prey.
Ability1Text: If Swellow has no Energy attached to it, Swellow's Retreat Cost is 0.
Attack1Text: If Swellow was on your Bench this turn, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

name: Tauros
flavorText: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Tauros you have in play. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, Tauros does 10 damage to itself.

name: Tentacruel
flavorText: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison.
Attack1Text: Search your opponent's discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to any of your opponent's Pokemon in any way you like. For each Energy card attached in this way, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: If Tentacruel has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokemon, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

name: Unown [J]
flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown J from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.
Attack1Text: Remove the Special Condition Asleep from the Defending Pokemon.

name: Unown [R]
flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if Unown R is on your Bench, you may discard Unown R and all cards attached to it. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokemon.) Then, draw a card.
Attack1Text: Move any number of basic Energy cards attached to your Pokemon to your other Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Unown [U]
flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: As long as Unown U is on your Bench, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done by your opponent's Pokemon to any Unown on your Bench.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for any 1 card and discard it. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Unown [V]
flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 2 damage counters from each of your Pokemon. If you do, your turn ends. This power can't be used if Unown V is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Unown [W]
flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: As long as Unown W is your Active Pokemon, any damage done to your Pokemon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Unown [Y]
flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown Y is on your Bench, you may remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Active Unown and that Unown is now Asleep.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Unown [?]
flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown ? is on your Bench, you may choose a Pokemon in your hand and put it face down. Your opponent guesses a type of that Pokemon. Reveal that card. If your opponent guessed wrong, draw a card. Then, put that card back into your hand.
Attack1Text: Discard up to 2 cards from your hand. For each card you discarded, draw a card.

name: Beldum
flavorText: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to Beldum (excluding effects of attacks or Poke-Powers), you may search your deck for Beldum and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beldum is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Beldum does 10 damage to itself.

name: Beldum
flavorText: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Bellsprout
flavorText: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't use any Poke-Powers during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Bellsprout does 10 damage to itself.

name: Buneary
flavorText: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.
Attack1Text: Remove all Special Conditions and 4 damage counters from Buneary. Buneary is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Chinchou
flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Chinchou
flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.
Attack2Text: If Chinchou has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Corphish
flavorText: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

name: Cubone
flavorText: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Dratini
flavorText: It is called the "Mirage Pokemon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Drifloon
flavorText: A Pokemon formed by the spirits of people and Pokemon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Grass Basic Pokemon and Psychic Basic Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Gligar
flavorText: It sails on the winds with its limbs extended to strike from the sky. It aims for the prey's face.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Gligar
flavorText: It sails on the winds with its limbs extended to strike from the sky. It aims for the prey's face.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Gloom
flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Gloom
flavorText: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Gloom. Gloom is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused and Poisoned.

name: Gulpin
flavorText: Almost all its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. That Pokemon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Hitmonchan
flavorText: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if Hitmonchan is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Hitmonchan is Knocked Out), put 4 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmonchan, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

name: Hitmonlee
flavorText: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.
Attack1Text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmonlee, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokemon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Hitmontop
flavorText: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by ten.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmontop, you may switch Hitmontop with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Horsea
flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Switch Horsea with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Houndour
flavorText: It conveys its feelings using different cries. It works in a pack to cleverly take down prey.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

name: Ledyba
flavorText: It is so timid, it can't move if it isn't with a swarm of others. It conveys its feelings with scent.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Ledyba does 10 damage to itself.

name: Lileep
flavorText: It lived on the seafloor 100 million years ago and was reanimated scientifically.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.
Attack2Text: Remove 2 damage counters from Lileep.

name: Meowth
flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: It loves to sneak up on people late at night, then startle them with its shrieklike cry.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Nincada
flavorText: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Nosepass
flavorText: Its nose is a magnet. As a result, this Pokemon always keeps its face pointing north.
Attack2Text: If Probopass is on your Bench, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Numel
flavorText: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Oddish
flavorText: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Remove 1 damage counter from Oddish.

name: Oddish
flavorText: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Pineco
flavorText: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokemon that peck it by mistake.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokemon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Pineco does 50 damage to itself.

name: Poliwag
flavorText: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Poliwhirl
flavorText: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Poochyena
flavorText: A Pokemon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Riolu
flavorText: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

name: Shinx
flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card attach it to Shinx. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Skitty
flavorText: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokemon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Sneasel
flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand. If your opponent has any Pokemon Tool or Technical Machine cards in his or her hand, put those cards on top of his or her deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

name: Spoink
flavorText: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: You may switch Spoink with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Staryu
flavorText: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy attached to Staryu and remove 3 damage counters from Staryu.

name: Swinub
flavorText: It loves eating mushrooms that grow under dead grass. It also finds hot springs while foraging.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Taillow
flavorText: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Taillow's Peck attack's base damage is 30.

name: Tentacool
flavorText: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Tentacool during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Tyrogue
flavorText: It is famous for its eagerness to fight and always nurses injuries from challenging larger foes.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Hitmonlee, Hitmonchan, or Hitmontop from your hand onto Tyrogue (this counts as evolving Tyrogue) and remove all damage counters from Tyrogue.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is an Evolved Pokemon, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and Tyrogue does 10 damage to itself.

name: Weepinbell
flavorText: A Pokemon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Yanma
flavorText: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won't miss prey—even those behind it.
Attack1Text: Switch Yanma with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Yanma during your opponent's next turn.

name: Technical Machine TS-1
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokemon and put it onto that Pokemon. (This counts as evolving that Pokemon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Technical Machine TS-2
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Evolved Pokemon (excluding Pokemon LV.X). Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokemon and put that card back into your opponent's hand.

name: Claw Fossil
Ability1Text: If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokemon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokemon.

name: Root Fossil
Ability1Text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.

name: Azelf LV.X
Ability1Text: Each of your Psychic Pokemon has no Weakness.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokemon for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Gliscor LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Gliscor LV.X from your hand onto your Active Gliscor, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon. That Pokemon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.
Attack1Text: You may switch Gliscor with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Magnezone LV.X
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Lightning or Metal Energy attached to 1 of your Pokemon to another of your Pokemon. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard a Lightning Energy and a Metal Energy attached to Magnezone. The Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Mesprit LV.X
Attack1Text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If don't have Uxie LV.X and Azelf LV.X in play, this attack does nothing. Discard all Energy attached to Mesprit.

name: Mewtwo LV.X
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo by your opponent's Pokemon that isn't an Evolved Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Discard all Energy attached to Mewtwo.

name: Rhyperior LV.X
Attack1Text: Discard the top 5 cards from your deck. This attack does 50 damage for each Energy card you discarded.
Attack2Text: Search your discard pile for all Fighting Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

name: Uxie LV.X
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck. This power can't be used if Uxie is affected by a Special Condition. You can't use more than 1 Trade Off Poke-Power each turn.
Attack1Text: Uxie can't use Zen Blade during your next turn.
